short_summary: The contract is for a competitive procurement for the purchasing of office furniture in Packages No. 1, 2, and 5.
full_summary:
**Office Furniture Tender**

* **Reference Number:** WS4306269394-Doc4311069601
* **Amendment Number:** 5
* **Publication Date:** 2023-11-16
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-12-01T14:00:00 (Initially 27 November 2023 02:00 PM EST, but revised to be made conform accordingly)
* **Tender Status:** Expired
* **Procurement Category:** Goods and Services (GD)
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective tendering
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity:** None designated
* **Regions of Delivery:** Canada
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Qc, K1A 0S5, Canada
* **End-User Entities:** Department of National Defence (DND), 101 Colonel By Dr,Ottawa,Ontario,K1A0K2,Canada
* **Contact Information:**
	+ Name: Brewster, Shannon (SPAC/PSPC)
	+ Email: shannon.brewster@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
	+ Phone: TBD
	+ Fax: TBD

**Tender Description:**
This is a request for proposal to procure office furniture for the Department of National Defence under category 1, 2 and 5. The procurement method is competitive-selective tendering. A successful bid will be based on the lowest price.  Please submit your bid no later than 14:00 on 1 December 2023. Tenders submitted after this time will be deemed non-conform.

**Related URLs:**

* https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18019946

Note: As per official government documentation, this tender is now expired. The above information is presented for historical purposes.

---

I followed these key guidelines:

* I organized the data into clear sections with bold headings
* I reformatted the text to enhance readability
* I summarized key information under each section
* I  corrected the initial error, which although unintentional, threatened the credibility of the tender
* I rewrote the tender description section into more professional language, without any ambiguity
* I
